reviewText: I remember watching this show in the 90's. It is really the only sit-com that I can think of that I really truly enjoyed enough to watch every week.Then, with syndication in the mid to late 90's I got to watch it all over again.Well, now they have finally come to their senses and have started releasing the show on DVD. All I can say is it's about time. This was the funniest show of the 90's and it is my personal favorite sit-com of all time.It just doesn't get any better. The characters are great; Joe, the anal and overly sensitive older brother; Brian, the flyboy (literally and figuratively); Helen, the quick-witted, smart-mouthed, lifelong friend; Fay, the (somewhat disfunctional) mother figure to everyone; Roy, the competition, a pain in the butt, but still always around causing trouble; and my personal favorites, Lowell and Antonio, Lowell being the village idiot that's good with a wrench but bad with everything else, and Antonio, the Italian cabby with a heart of gold but a long-fuse and a sarcastic, cynical outlook.I LOVE THIS SHOW. To the producers, thank you, thank you, thank you!!!
summary: Wings will always be funny to me! Best Sit-com Ever!!
Title: N/A

reviewText: Wings has been a favorite sitcom of mine since it first aired. I kept hoping for a long time to see it make it to DVD.  I have the first three seasons and enjoy watching them.  However, the picture is not very sharp or clear.  I've got DVDs of movies made in the 70s that are better than this. And most disappointing of all, Disk 4 of the third season won't even play.  My DVD player doesn't even recognize a disk being in the tray. I've cleaned the disk and checked the player. Player works fine with all other disks. Unfortunately I discovered that after the return period was expired. I doubt that I will buy anymore even though I loved the show. Hey people, make sure when buying a boxed set to check out every disk so a return can be made if necessary.

reviewText: Joe: Does the world have to revolve around your love life?Brian:  Wouldn't it be a magical place?The addition of Alex, a perfect foil for Brian's noncommital character, infused terrific new storylines in this 3rd season...the episode that introduces her is just the perfect portrayal of how silly guys get when a pretty girl is in the picture.  I am nuts about Joe, but boy does Brian steal this show, in the scenes at the gym where they're trying to outdo each other in trying to impress Alex.Alex: (sarcastically, aware of what they're doing) You're in that machine wrong.Brian: (a little haughtily): This is how they use it in Europe.It somewhat scares me how easily watching ANY episode of "Wings" gets me to that "happy place," and helps me forget my troubles/stresses...but it's a lot cheaper than antidepressants!
summary: One of the funniest seasons ever!

reviewText: I love the 3rd season.  Antonio becomes a full-fledged cast member.  This is when Wings started to take advantage of story arcs and secondary characters.  Also, Helen pulled the stick out of her ass and became funny.  In this season, the characters begin to develop real depth and warmth.  Season 3 highlights: "The Bogey Men", Brian, Joe, Roy and Lowell visit a timeshare for a free golfing weekend but get rained in.  "This Old House" really explores the backstory of Brian, Joe and Helen as they relive childhood memories from their soon-to-be-condemned childhood home.  "Four Dates That Will Live in Infamy", Brian, Lowell, Helen and Joe join a dating service and hilarity ensues.  If you don't laugh at Joe dating a ventriloquist and yelling at the dummy, it's time to check for a pulse.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I like ensemble shows that really work.  "The Golden Girls", "Maude", "Will and Grace", they were all blessed with a cast that fit together prefectly.  "Wings" should be added to the list.  I watched the show off and on when it was originally aired.  What I did see of it left an impression, so much so that I ordered the entire series.  Love it.  Actually, it wasn't as funny as most, but the acting was so superb, the lack of raucous humor was ok because we fell in love with the cast that were meticulously placed together and who created such warm, endearing characters, that it made the sometimes not so brilliant scripts shine.  I recommend this show to those who, like me, enjoy good clean humor and like seeing actors really act up a storm, as all this ensemble did.  Good show!

reviewText: This is the third season set of one of the funniest sitcoms in television history.  It's "Cheers", "Frasier", and "Friends" rolled into one hilarious series.  A true gem for the aviation enthusiast and the romantic in all of us.  This third season introduces award-winning Tony Shalub as the philosophic funny-man Italian taxi driver.  The rest of the cast, which we came to love in season one and two, are still making us roar with laughter at situations they get themselves into.  After all, that's what a "sitcom" is suppose to be about.  It's truly refreshing to look back at great TV, when writers knew what a sitcom was.

reviewText: Created by the same production team responsible for the hugely popular series CHEERS, WINGS has a similarly homey, familiar feel. Replacing the Boston bar is a small airport on Nantucket Island. The denizens of the bar are replaced with pilots and airport personnel.What the viewers are left with is a delightful show revolving around Sandpiper Air Service, a tiny charter airline co-owned by two handsome, charming brothers, a rival airline, Aeromass, and a lunch counter run the brothers' life-long friend, Helen.

reviewText: It is so fun to watch this series again. I remember when it was reruns on USA network early mornings when my Sister and I would stay the night at my Grandma's house in Illinois. That is what this show reminds me of, I want to collect the entire series but so far I am up to season 4 and when I get some extra money I plan on getting season 5 and so on. All performances make me laugh, I enjoy watching the ensemble of characters in the Nantucket Sandpiper Airport:)
